courseObjectives: To develop mathematical skills for solving computer science problems.
courseOutcomes: MA501.1 Solve a homogeneous and non-homogeneous system of linear equations using rank of a matrix.
MA501.2 Solve system of linear equations by Numerical Methods.
MA501.3 Solve equations in real life problems and to encode and decode messages using the concept of matrices.
MA501.4 Identify whether given structures are vector spaces and subspaces and construct a basis for them.
MA501.5 Show if a given matrix is diagonalizable or not.
MA501.6 Apply concepts of eigenvalues and eigenvectors to calculate functions of a square matrix, Google page rank vector and solve systems of differential equations.

modules.title: Basics of matrices
topics: Revision of basic matrices and types of matrices
Row echelon form, Reduced Row Echelon form, Rank of a matrix

modules.title: Linear equations & its solutions
topics: Consistency and solution of simultaneous linear homogeneous and non-homogeneous equations
Application of solving systems of equations in traffic control
Solution by Gauss Elimination, Gauss Jordan, Gauss Jacobi, Gauss Seidel, LU Decomposition - Crout’s method

modules.title: Vector spaces
topics: Vector space, subspace, span, linear dependence and independence of vectors
Basis, dimension, orthogonal projection & Gram-Schmidt process

modules.title: Encoding & decoding using Matrices
topics: Application of matrices to coding and decoding

modules.title: Eigenvalues and Eigenvectors
topics: Diagonalisation of matrices, Application to find Google page rank

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: Normal form, Solving KVL circuits using matrices, Singular Value Decomposition
Quadratic forms, Spectral theorem for Hermitian matrices

courseObjectives: To learn fundamentals of Data Structures.
courseOutcomes: MC501.1 Apply various operations of Stack, Queue and Linked List to solve problems from different domains.
MC501.2 Apply various operations of Tree and Graph to solve problems from different domains.
MC501.3 Make use of searching and hashing techniques for efficient data retrieval and data mapping.
MC501.4 Compare efficiency of various sorting algorithms.

modules.title: Introduction to Data Structure and Algorithms
topics: Introduction to Time and Space Complexity

modules.title: Linked List, Stack and Queue
topics: Linked List as an ADT, Types of Linked List (Singly, Doubly, Circular), Operations of Linked List
Applications of Linked List: Polynomial addition and subtraction
Stack ADT, Stack operations, Applications of Stack: Postfix expression evaluation, Infix to Postfix conversion
Queue ADT, Queue operations, Circular Queue, Priority Queue, Applications of Queue: Round Robin CPU Scheduling

modules.title: Tree and Graph
topics: Binary Tree, Binary Search Tree, Expression Tree, Huffman Tree, AVL Tree, B Tree, Heap Tree
Graph Representation, Graph Traversal Techniques, Shortest Path Algorithms

modules.title: Searching and Hashing Techniques
topics: Sequential Search, Binary Search, Interpolation Search
Hashing Techniques and Collision resolution techniques

modules.title: Sorting Techniques
topics: Internal Sorting Techniques: Bubble Sort, Insertion Sort, Selection Sort, Radix Sort, Quick Sort, Heap Sort

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: Applications of Linked list: Sparse Matrix and other real life applications
Applications of Stack: Recursion and other real life applications

courseObjectives: To be familiar with a broad range of mathematical objects like sets, functions, relational graphs that is omnipresent in computer science.
courseOutcomes: MA502.1 Construct simple mathematical proofs and verify them.
MA502.2 Apply core ideas of Set Theory, Logic, Relations Functions, and Recurrence Relations.
MA502.3 Solve examples using graphs, trees and their various types with their traversing techniques.

modules.title: Set Theory and Logic
topics: Union, Intersection, Disjoint, and Difference of two sets
Relations and Diagraphs - Properties of Relations

modules.title: Relational Structures on Sets: Relations & Graphs
Sizes of Sets: Counting & Combinatorics
topics: Linear Recurrence relations - methods of solutions

modules.title: Structured Sets: Algebraic Structures
topics: Structured sets with respect to binary operations
Groups, Semigroups, Monoids, Rings, and Fields

courseObjectives: To learn the fundamentals of database systems.
courseOutcomes: MC502.1 Design ER diagram and relational database.
MC502.2 Apply normalization on given database.
MC502.3 Analyze transaction and concurrency control mechanism.
MC502.4 Illustrate emerging database systems.
MC502.5 Formulate SQL queries for information retrieval.
MC502.6 Demonstrate various PL/SQL queries.

modules.title: Introduction to DBMS, ER and Relational Model
topics: File system organization, Purpose of Database system
Data models, Codd rules, DBMS architecture
Entity set & Relationship set, Mapping cardinalities, ER diagram

modules.title: Query Optimization, Normalization and Functional Dependencies
topics: Query processing steps, Evaluation of Query

modules.title: Transaction Management, Concurrency Control, Database Recovery
topics: ACID properties, Transaction states, Serializability and its types
Lock based protocol, Timestamp based protocol
Recovery Techniques based on Deferred and Immediate Update, Shadow paging, ARIES recovery algorithm

modules.title: Distributed and Parallel Database
topics: Distributed Databases: Overview, Types, Data fragmentation, replication, and allocation techniques
Query processing and Concurrency control in Distributed DB
Parallel Databases: Architecture, Types of parallelism, Types of Partitioning

modules.title: XML and Object-Based Databases
topics: XML documents, Approaches to store XML documents, Extracting XML documents from Relational Database
Object-Based Databases: Complex data types, Inheritance in SQL, Object identity and Reference types in SQL

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: Tuple Relational Calculus and Domain Relational Calculus

courseObjectives: To introduce the fundamentals of software engineering principles and practices.
courseOutcomes: MC503.1 Analyze requirements for relevant process models.
MC503.2 Design system models with Software Requirement Specification.
MC503.3 Apply estimation techniques for software planning.
MC503.4 Apply umbrella activities for the software.

modules.title: Introduction to Software Process Models
topics: Software Engineering concepts and Process Models: Prescriptive Model, Evolutionary Process Model, Incremental Model
Agile Software Development: Basics of Agile Process models, Principles of Agile, Agile Manifesto, Test Driven Development

modules.title: Requirement Engineering
topics: Elicitation: Interviews, Questionnaire, Brainstorming, Facilitated Application Specification Technique
Requirement Analysis, Feasibility Study, Types of Feasibility
Agile Requirements: User stories, Backlog Management, Agile Architecture, Feature Driven Development

modules.title: Software Design
topics: Architectural Design: Client Server, Pipe and Filter
Overview of UML Diagrams: Behavioral and Implementation view
Design Patterns: Gang of four patterns

modules.title: Software Project Scheduling
topics: Work Breakdown Structure (WBS), Critical Path Method (CPM), Program Evaluation and Review Technique (PERT), Gantt Chart
Estimation: Decomposition techniques, Empirical estimation models
Agile Maturity Model and Agile Estimation Techniques: Planning Poker, Shirt Sizes, Dot Voting, Bucket System

modules.title: Software Testing
topics: Overview of White Box Testing and Black Box Testing
Overview of Testing strategies and Agile Testing

modules.title: Software Umbrella Activities
topics: Risk Management: Risk Identification, Risk Assessment, Risk Projection, Risk Mitigation, Monitoring and Management (RMMM)
Software Configuration Management (SCM): Version and change control, SCM process
Software Quality Assurance (SQA): Overview of McCall’s Quality Model

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: Requirement Prototyping, Cost Benefit Analysis, Cohesion and Coupling
Cleanroom Software engineering, 3R - Refactoring, Reengineering, Reusability

courseObjectives: To introduce the web technology concepts that are required for developing web applications.
courseOutcomes: MC504.1 Create web pages using HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript.
MC504.2 Design web pages using Angular concepts and components.
MC504.3 Develop dynamic web pages using Node and Express.js.
MC504.4 Develop web pages and store it in database using Node.js.

modules.title: HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript
topics: Create web pages using HTML5 and CSS3

modules.title: Angular Basics
topics: Introduction to Angular concepts and components

modules.title: Node.js and Express.js
topics: Develop dynamic web pages using Node.js and Express.js
REST APIs using Node.js and Express.js

modules.title: Database Integration
topics: Connect web pages to a database using Node.js
Perform CRUD operations using a database

courseObjectives: To apply the principles of business writing for professional documents.
To develop vocabulary and grammar for professional communication.
To draft formal reports.
courseOutcomes: AS501.1 Apply the principles of business writing for professional documents.
AS501.2 Develop advanced vocabulary and grammar for spoken and written communication.
AS501.3 Draft a formal report.

modules.title: Vocabulary Building & Grammar
topics: Root words from foreign languages and their use in English
Common errors in writing, confused pair of words, redundancies, clichés

modules.title: Writing Skills
topics: Principles of Business Writing: 7 Cs of communication
Sentence structure, organizing paragraph in direct and indirect style

modules.title: Practices in Writing
topics: Business Letter: Full block format, modified block format
Job Application Letter: Cover letter, Resume writing

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: Reading a book (fiction/non-fiction) and writing a review of it

subjectName: Problem Solving Using Object Oriented Programming Lab
courseObjectives: To develop programming skills of students, using object oriented programming concepts, learn the concept of class and object using C++ and develop classes for simple applications.
courseOutcomes: MC505.1 Construct programs using basic control structures.
MC505.2 Apply objects and structures in problem solving.
MC505.3 Apply arrays and pointers efficiently to solve the problems.
MC505.4 Design the solutions using inheritance and polymorphism.
MC505.5 Apply concepts of virtual functions, exception handling to create efficient solutions.
MC505.6 Construct the solutions using File handling and Standard Template Library.

modules.title: Objects and Classes
topics: Physical C++ Objects as Data Types

modules.title: OOP Concepts
topics: Pitfalls of Operators Overloading and Conversion Keywords
Normal Member Functions Accessed with Pointers
Virtual Member Functions Accessed with Pointers
Abstract Classes and Pure Virtual Functions

courseObjectives: To give an exposure to the students about the basic concepts of Probability and Statistical methods and their application.
courseOutcomes: MA503.1 Apply different statistical measures on various types of data.
MA503.2 Perform Hypothesis testing on the data given to validate the assumptions.
MA503.3 Illustrate basic probability axioms, rules and their applicability.
MA503.4 Apply probability distribution to solve given problems.

modules.title: Measures of Central Tendency & Measures of Dispersion
Testing of Hypothesis
topics: Hypothesis, Type I and Type II errors
Tests of significance – Student's t-test: Single Mean, Difference of Means
Chi-Square Test: Test of Goodness of Fit, Independence Test

modules.title: Introduction to Probability
topics: Discrete, Continuous and Mixed Random Variables

modules.title: Conditional Probability
topics: Special Theoretical Probability Distributions - Bernoulli, Binomial, Uniform, Normal, Exponential

courseObjectives: To build programming concepts using object-oriented constructs.
To analyze real-world problems for database connection and file handling using exception handling.
To develop web applications using JSP and Servlets.
To explain the concept of Spring and Hibernate in advanced Java programming.
courseOutcomes: MC506.1 Build programming concept using OO constructs.
MC506.2 Analyze real world problem for database connection and file handling using Exception handling.
MC506.3 Develop Web Applications using JSP and Servlets.
MC506.4 Explain concept of Spring and Hibernate in advanced Java programming.

modules.title: Introduction to Java
topics: Java Basics: Data Types, Variables, and Operators
Control Statements: Conditional Statements and Loops

modules.title: Exception Handling and File Handling
topics: Exception Handling: Try, Catch, Finally, Throw, Throws
File Handling: File Class, FileReader, FileWriter

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: Java 8 Features: Lambda Expressions and Streams

courseObjectives: To analyze time and space complexity of different algorithms.
To analyze various divide & conquer algorithms.
To apply greedy and dynamic methods to given problems.
To utilize backtracking, branch and bound techniques, and graphs to solve problems.
courseOutcomes: MC507.1 Analyze time and space complexity of different algorithms.
MC507.2 Analyze various divide & conquer algorithms.
MC507.3 Apply greedy and dynamic method to given problem.
MC507.4 Make use of backtracking, branch and bound techniques, and graphs to solve a problem.

modules.title: Fundamentals of Algorithmic Problem Solving
topics: The Role of Algorithms in Computing
Time Complexity: Worst Case, Best Case, Average Case Analysis
Asymptotic Notations: Big O, Omega, Theta

modules.title: Analysis of Various Algorithms and Divide and Conquer
topics: Complexity Calculation of Sorting Techniques using Asymptotic Notation

modules.title: Greedy Method & Dynamic Programming
topics: Minimum Cost Spanning Tree: Kruskal and Prim's Algorithm

modules.title: Branch and Bound
topics: Introduction to Branch and Bound Technique
Bounding and FIFO Branch and Bound
Least Cost Search Branch and Bound

modules.title: Graph Algorithms
topics: Single Source Shortest Path: Dijkstra's Algorithm
All Pair Shortest Path: Floyd-Warshall Algorithm

modules.title: Self-Study Topics
topics: String Matching Algorithm: Brute Force String Matching
Approximation Algorithm: P and NP Complete Problem

courseObjectives: To provide students with good knowledge and training about the Ionic framework along with databases using Firebase and Node.
courseOutcomes: MC509.1 Install the Ionic framework with all the dependencies.
MC509.2 Create apps using the components of the Ionic framework and SASS stylesheet.
MC509.3 Create apps using APIs of the Ionic framework.
MC509.4 Create apps with backend connectivity.

modules.title: Installation and Basic Application
topics: To install Ionic and its development environment.
Run the basic default application to understand the files used.

modules.title: Museum App Development
topics: Create a Museum app using basic UI components and SASS (Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets).

modules.title: Department App with Tabs Navigation
topics: Create an app for the MCA department using Tabs Navigation.

modules.title: File Handling App
topics: Create an app to upload, download, and view PDF in an image.

modules.title: SPIT App Development
topics: Create SPIT app using side navigation drawer and Tabs navigation.

modules.title: Educational App for Children
topics: Create an app for children to study numbers and alphabets.

modules.title: Camera and Calendar API Integration
topics: Develop an app with Camera and Calendar API integrated in one app.

modules.title: HTTP Request and Response
topics: Implement HTTP request and response (REST API) to update and retrieve data in JSON file.

modules.title: Student Information App with Firebase
topics: Create an app to store student information using Firebase as database.

modules.title: Feedback App with Firebase
topics: Create an app for feedback of students along with the ratings and store and retrieve from Firebase.

courseObjectives: To enhance students' communication abilities and presentation skills for professional settings.
courseOutcomes: AS502.1 Demonstrate persuasive skills in interviews.
AS502.2 Demonstrate creative and critical thinking in Group Discussions.
AS502.3 Explain research, analysis, and presentation skills.
AS502.4 Apply data transformation skills.

modules.title: Persuasive Skills in Interviews
topics: Persuasion using facial expressions, gestures, body language.
Persuasion using voice, verbal style, verbal content.

modules.title: Research, Analysis, and Presentation Skills
topics: What is research? Types of research.

modules.title: Data Transformation
topics: Graphics to Paragraphs and vice versa.

courseObjectives: To introduce basic concepts and techniques of machine learning and develop skills of using recent machine learning software for solving practical problems.
courseOutcomes: MC511.1 Explain basic concept and need of machine learning.
MC511.2 Apply machine learning algorithms to solve the given problem.
MC511.3 Explain various reinforcement learning techniques.
MC511.4 Apply Dimensionality reduction techniques.
MC511.5 Make use of basic concepts of Python/R to solve given problems.

modules.title: Introduction To Machine Learning
topics: Machine learning vs AI, machine learning vs Deep learning.
Learning types: Supervised Learning, Unsupervised learning, Reinforcement learning.
General Steps or Process of Machine Learning.

modules.title: Supervised Learning
topics: Regression fundamentals, Linear Regression, Polynomial regression.
Classification fundamentals, Logistic Regression, Decision trees.

modules.title: Unsupervised Learning
topics: Clustering basics: K-means clustering, K-Nearest Neighbor.

modules.title: Reinforcement Learning
topics: Markov Decision Processes, Monte Carlo Prediction.

modules.title: Applications of Machine Learning
topics: Machine Learning Applications across Industries: Healthcare, Retail, Financial Services, Hospitality.

selfStudyTopics: Exploring tools used in ML, TensorFlow, Keras, Scikit-learn.

courseObjectives: This course is designed to provide the core knowledge necessary to understand DevOps concepts, its principles and practices and tools.
courseOutcomes: MC520.1 To understand basic concepts of DevOps.
MC520.2 Install, configure & use container technologies.
MC520.3 Apply testing tools for software, quality code & security testing.

modules.title: Overview of DevOps
topics: Introduction to DevOps: Define the concept of DevOps, explain its origins, and describe its benefits and challenges.

modules.title: Git, Jenkins, Ansible Integration
topics: Branching and Merging in Git, Git workflows.

modules.title: Containerization with Docker
topics: Understanding images and containers, Running Hello World in Docker.

modules.title: Containerization using Kubernetes
topics: Cluster Architecture, Spinning up a Kubernetes Cluster on Ubuntu VMs.

modules.title: Functional Testing and Continuous Monitoring
topics: Security Testing, Continuous Monitoring with Nagios.

modules.title: Advanced Analytics
topics: Case Studies of Data Visualization Applications
